<h4 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Description</h4>

This function summarizes background respiration files, allowing users to better understand system-wide respiration rates across all channels. 

For example, it may be used to explore the variability of background respiration rates between different respirometry chambers or to explore overtime changes in background respiration. 

<p style="color:darkred;  text-align: left">Updates in progress</p>

<h4><a style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left" name="Arguments">Arguments</a></h4>

  Argument       | Description | Default
---: | :------------- | :---
**data**        | The name of the data file “(…)_analyzed.csv_” containing analyzed regressions of measurement cycles (post `SMR`). A character.  | --
**Ch**          | Specify channels for analysis. A numeric vector. | --
**resp.ID**     | A character vector with respirometry IDs. | --
**resp.Vol**    | A numeric vector of respirometry volumes (L). | --

<br><h4><a name="Value" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Value</a></h4>

The function is most helpful if summarizing background respiration measured for a extended period (many measurement cycles).

<h5 style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left; text-indent:+10px;"><i class="fas fa-ellipsis-h"></i>&nbsp; Data outputs</h5>

**“.csv files”**

- “(…)_BACK_SLOPES.csv”
  * saved in a local directory (./)
  * metrics included: 
    + Channel ID,
    + Respirometry chamber ID,
    + Respirometry chamber volume (L),
    + temperature,
    + summary of R^2^ (min, max, mean),
    + summary of regression slopes (min, max, mean),
    + the number of measurements,
    + the datafile name. 

**”.png files”**

- “(…)_ChX_backSlopes_PLOT.png, where (X = the number of channels)
  * saved in the local directory
  * a frequency plot of all background respiration slopes for each channel

<br><h4><a name="Details" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Details</a></h4> <br>

This function allows the analysis of one file at a time. 

<br><h4><a name="Example" style="color:#495057; font-weight: bold;  text-align: left">Example</a></h4> <br>

<pre class = "sourceCode yaml"> 

 sum_backgr(data = "jul04_2019_box4_back_post_dummy_analyzed.csv",
            Ch = c(1,2,3,4), 
            resp.ID = c("A", "B", "D", "E"),
            resp.Vol = c(1.5, 1.5, 1.5, 1.5))

</pre>
